metadata.title: How to Optimize YouTube Descriptions 2025: Description Writing Guide
metadata.description: Write YouTube descriptions that boost SEO and engagement. Templates and best practices.

hero.headline: How to Optimize YouTube Descriptions
hero.subheadline: The most underutilized real estate on YouTube. Make your descriptions work harder.

sections.content: YouTube descriptions are searchable, clickable real estate that most creators waste. The first 200 characters appear in search results, and the full description helps YouTube understand your content. Optimized descriptions improve discoverability and drive action.

content.title: First 200 Characters
content.description: Most critical. Shows in search results. Hook + keyword + value.

content.title: Full Description
content.description: Expand on content. Include keywords naturally. Add context.

content.title: Links Section
content.description: Social media, website, resources. Drive traffic beyond YouTube.

content.title: Keywords
content.description: Include target keyword in first 200 chars. Natural usage throughout.

content.title: Timestamps
content.description: Creates chapters. Helps viewers navigate. SEO bonus.

content.title: Hashtags
content.description: 3-5 relevant hashtags. Clickable for discovery. Don't overdo.

content.title: Natural Language
content.description: Write for humans, not algorithms. Keyword stuffing hurts.

faq.question: How long should descriptions be?
faq.answer: At least 200 words for SEO. But quality over quantity. Cover what's needed. Some creators use 500+ words with full transcripts.

faq.question: Do descriptions affect search ranking?
faq.answer: Yes, especially first 200 characters. YouTube uses description to understand content. Keywords here help discoverability.

faq.question: Should I include timestamps?
faq.answer: Yes for videos over 5 minutes. Creates chapters in YouTube player. Improves user experience. Small SEO benefit too.

faq.question: How many hashtags should I use?
faq.answer: 3-5 is optimal. First 3 appear above title on desktop. Too many looks spammy. Relevant hashtags only.
